TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
41 ¶Vita sancti Dominici confesso&rrot;is.
SEint Domenic þe holie frere &punctelev; in spa&ydot;ne was ibo&rrot;e
In þe toune of Ca&ydot;lre &punctelev; wel guod was þe mo&rrot;e
Sire felice Felice is fader het &punctelev; is moder dame Ione
glad was þe Moder of þe sone &punctelev; þat fo&rrot; him gan ofte grone
Þeo ȝwile þat þis holie child &punctelev; in is Moder wombe was
hire þouȝte ase heo la&ydot; aslepe &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e louerd ȝaf þat cas
þat heo bar in hire wombe a be&slong;t &punctelev; þat faire&slong;te in an&ydot; lond
And þat be&slong;t bar riȝt in is Mouth &punctelev; ane berninde b&rrot;ond
þe b&rrot;ond in þusse be&slong;tes mouth &punctelev; þo it was of hire ibo&rrot;e
Schon so þat al cri&slong;tinedom &punctelev; þe b&rrot;iȝto&rrot;e was þarefo&rrot;e
And so wide so was cri&slong;tinedom &punctelev; And þare was so deo&rrot;k so n&ydot;ȝt
þe b&rrot;ond in þe be&slong;tes Mouþe &punctelev; hire þouȝte ȝaf gret liȝt
þo þat child was ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; and ib&rrot;ouȝt to cri&slong;tindom
Also bifeol þat a guod lauedi &punctelev; þat him of watere nam
þouȝte þat þare was a &slong;teo&rrot;re &punctelev; In his fo&rrot;eheued so b&rrot;iȝt
þat þo&rrot;uout al cri&slong;tinedom &punctelev; schon and ȝaf gret lijȝt
Ȝwat was þis schiningue of þis child &punctelev; bote þat he scholde b&rrot;ingue
to godes Godes lawe Mani a man &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ is guode p&rrot;echingue
And þat he scholde an o&rrot;d&rrot;e make &punctelev; of frere p&rrot;echours þat ȝet is
þat þareþo&rrot;uȝ al cri&slong;tinedom &punctelev; amendi scholde iwis
þis child þeo ȝw&ydot;le it was ȝong &punctelev; to guode d&rrot;ouȝ anon
to fa&slong;tingue and to almesdede &punctelev; and wolle werie[Vern. wolleward] to gon
In is bedde he nolde beo &punctelev; bote wel lu&ydot;te &slong;tounde
Ake ligge in is o&rrot;esones &punctelev; opon þe harde grounde
þo he was sethþe to scole iset &punctelev; a deo&rrot;e ȝer þare cam
his bokes he solde and al is guod &punctelev; and alle þe panes he nam
And delde heom alle to pouere men &punctelev; ant ne lefde himsulf riȝt noȝt
þe t&ydot;þingue of is godhede &punctelev; was sone wide ib&rrot;ouȝt
So þat þe bischop of þe lond &punctelev; louede him wel inouȝ
And enqueo&rrot;ede of is dedes &punctelev; þat to alle guode he d&rrot;ouȝ
heiȝ man he made him sone &punctelev; and chanun seculer
Wel lu&ydot;te tolde þe holie Man &punctelev; of is grete power
Þare weren false cri&slong;tine Men &punctelev; aboute in þe londe
þat nolden nouȝt clanliche &punctelev; þe riȝte bileue onder&slong;tonde
Ne hu&ydot; ne bilefden nouȝt þat o&rrot;e louerd were ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; of þe maide Marie
Swuch manere fals bileue &punctelev; Men cleopeden heresie
Aȝein heom þis holie man &punctelev; despu&ydot;tede alda&ydot; fa&slong;te
And manie of heom þo&rrot;uȝ godes Godes grace &punctelev; into riȝte bileue heom ca&slong;te
An Eo&rrot;l þare was in þe londe þo &punctelev; þat guod Man was inouȝ
Sire S&ydot;mon de Mountfo&rrot;t &punctelev; þat to alle guodnesse d&rrot;ouȝ
his fader þat was here aslawe &punctelev; among us in Engelonde
Atþe bata&ydot;le of Euesham &punctelev; þat longue wo&rrot;th onder&slong;tonde
Þis guode kn&ydot;ȝt sire S&ydot;mon &punctelev; &slong;trong kn&ydot;ȝt was inouȝ
And aȝein þis vuele cri&slong;tine Men &punctelev; to bata&ydot;le al da&ydot; he d&rrot;ouȝ
Seint Domenic also aboute ȝeode &punctelev; and p&rrot;echede aȝein heom wel fa&slong;te
So þat þis twe&ydot;e guode Men &punctelev; togadere heo&rrot;e heo&rrot;te ca&slong;te
Þat hu&ydot; weren boþe at one rede &punctelev; þe on with his p&rrot;echingue
Þe oþur with &slong;trencþe of bataille &punctelev; þat folk to guode b&rrot;ingue
And þe guode Erol[r. Eo&rrot;l] s&ydot;re s&ydot;mon &punctelev; þe ȝwile is lijf ila&slong;te
Euere heold op with his power &punctelev; seint Dompnic wel fa&slong;te
And þo&rrot;uȝ is pouer muchedel &punctelev; þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e he bigan
Of frere p&rrot;echours þat ȝeot is &punctelev; fo&rrot;to saui mani a man
bitwene þis men fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e heresie &punctelev; þe &slong;triuingue ofte was
And þe holie Manne seint Domenic &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e louerd ȝaf þat cas
Opon þe hul of vitto&rrot;ie &punctelev; A da&ydot; þare was inome
Of desputisun bitweone heom &punctelev; and þo þe da&ydot; was icome
Seint Domenic cam fo&rrot;th þo &punctelev; and In a writ he b&rrot;ouȝte
his resones fo&rrot; cri&slong;tindom &punctelev; and þis luþere Men it bitauȝte
to counseilie heom þareupon bet &punctelev; and Answerien þareto
Oþur beon &slong;tudefa&slong;to&rrot;e in heo&rrot;e bileue &punctelev; bote hu&ydot; heom couþen ondo
þis Men of heo&rrot;e heresie &punctelev; louȝwen þo wel smere;[A v. om.]
A gret fu&ydot;r hu&ydot; maden anon &punctelev; and þat writ heo ca&slong;ten In þere
And seiden ȝif it barnde þo &punctelev; of none vertue it nere
Þat writ la&ydot; longue in þat fu&ydot;r &punctelev; and neuere þe weo&rrot;se it nas
Ne nouȝt iwemned of one lette[r] &punctelev; and þat was a fair cas
Þo þe luþere Men iseien þis &punctelev; anu&ydot;de hu&ydot; weren so&rrot;e
hu&ydot; nomen þat bok and seiden anon &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; wolden ȝeot fondi mo&rrot;e
hu&ydot; ca&slong;ten eftsone into þe fu&ydot;r &punctelev; and þe þridde t&ydot;me also
And euere þat writ was also sound &punctelev; as it was þareinne ido
þis Men of heo&rrot;e heresie &punctelev; ischende heom heolden þo
And nolden nouȝt ȝeot al clanliche &punctelev; out of heo&rrot;e folie go
Seint domenic Domenic þis holie Man &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e louerd ȝaf þat cas
In þe Cite of tolouse &punctelev; ten ȝer togadere he was
he þouȝte bigu&ydot;nne a godes Godes name &punctelev; ȝif he miȝte it b&rrot;ingue to ende
An o&rrot;d&rrot;e of Men to p&rrot;echi fa&slong;te &punctelev; and aboute þe wo&rrot;ld to wende
þat miȝten þo&rrot;uȝout cri&slong;tindom &punctelev; Men wissi and rede
Ȝeo&rrot;ne he bad to Iesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; helpe him to þis dede
So þat þe pope Innocent &punctelev; a gret counseil Inouȝ
Makede at rome þulke t&ydot;me &punctelev; and muche folk þudere d&rrot;ouȝ
Seint Domenic wel mildeliche &punctelev; þudere gan to wende
Ȝif he miȝte anie grace habbe &punctelev; to b&rrot;ingue is o&rrot;d&rrot;e to ende
he cam and bad þe pope leue &punctelev; swuch þing fo&rrot;to do
þe pope makede him dauncherous &punctelev; and nolde ensenti þerto
¶A niȝt as þe pope lai aslepe &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e louerd ȝaf þat cas
him þouȝte þat þe churche of rome &punctelev; al adoneward was
Of seint Iohanes de lateran Lateran &punctelev; and as he lai þere
he lokede euere and al þat folk &punctelev; ȝwane hu&ydot; ouerfalle were
And seint Domenic heold up aȝen &punctelev; and fa&slong;te schef withoute
Wal ant t&ydot;mber he pulte aȝein &punctelev; and fa&slong;te o&rrot;n aboute
þe pope þo he awok &punctelev; In grete þouȝte la&ydot;
Ȝwat þis bitocningue miȝte beo &punctelev; þat he slepinde isaiȝ
he þouȝte þat þe &slong;tat of holi churche &punctelev; swu&ydot;þe ifebled were
And þat cri&slong;tinedom in Manie &slong;tudes &punctelev; in riȝt guod &slong;tat it nere
And þat seint Domenic þo&rrot;uȝ is o&rrot;d&rrot;e &punctelev; hire scholde helpe arere
þo&rrot;uȝ his p&rrot;echingue wide in londe &punctelev; cri&slong;tine men to lere
þe pope amo&rrot;ewe sente aftur him &punctelev; and grauntede him wel fawe
to maken is o&rrot;d&rrot;e a godes Godes name &punctelev; and folk to guode d&rrot;awe
bote þat he[he on the margin.] heom scheowede is ru&ydot;le &punctelev; to alle is cardinales þere
And þat hu&ydot; weren ip&rrot;ouede guode &punctelev; are hu&ydot; iconfermede were
So þat þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e of frere p&rrot;echours &punctelev; seint Domenic bigan þo
þat hath isaued wel mani a man &punctelev; and ȝeot it schal wel mo
clerkes hu&ydot; onderfenguen sone &punctelev; þat þe Abite nome
So þat euere mo and mo &punctelev; freres þere bicome
SEint Domenic matte þo In a niȝt &punctelev; þat seint petur Petur him bitok
Ane &slong;taf ase he cam to him &punctelev; and seint powel Powel ane bok
Þo po&rrot;ueide he in is o&rrot;d&rrot;e &punctelev; ȝwane freres wenden ouer lond
to bere ane bok at heo&rrot;e rugges &punctelev; and ane &slong;taf in heo&rrot;e hond
Sethþe him þouȝte aslepe also &punctelev; þat he saiȝ þe freres go
þo&rrot;uȝ þe londe two and two &punctelev; and togadere non mo
Into Tolouse he wende þo &punctelev; and bilefte himsulf þere
And sone[V. summe] he sente is freres aboute &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; departet were
Into spa&ydot;nne he sente some &punctelev; and to paris also
And þat þridde Couent to bolo&ydot;gne &punctelev; heo&rrot;e o&rrot;d&rrot;e fo&rrot;th to do
he het heom wende to and two &punctelev; and p&rrot;echi in þat lond
At heo&rrot;e rugge bere ane bok &punctelev; and ane &slong;taf in ho&rrot;e hond
¶A wonder sweuene seint Domenic &punctelev; In his slep iseiȝ
Ore louerd him wrathþede swiþe &punctelev; op in þe e&ydot;r an heiȝ
þreo launcene he heold in is hond &punctelev; þe po&ydot;nt toward þe grounde
Riȝt ase he wolde al þene wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ sm&ydot;te In one &slong;tounde
So ferelich he was to biholde &punctelev; þat it nas non ende
þo cam o&rrot;e leuedi liȝte adoun &punctelev; þat is so milde and hende
A mi sone heo seide ȝwat þene&slong;t þou &punctelev; mcrci and þin o&rrot;e
Inelle seide o&rrot;e louerd &punctelev; þis sunne &punctelev; þolie mo&rrot;e
he seide al þis wo&rrot;ld is ful of sunne &punctelev; and ful ȝare hath ibeo
And þarefo&rrot;e ichulle al þene wo&rrot;ld asle &punctelev; with þeose launces þreo
Ore leuedi heold up hire hondene &punctelev; and sat adoun akneo
And seide leoue sone nouþe þin o&rrot;e &punctelev; þov mo&slong;t þe bet biseo
þou mo&slong;t þine wratþe mienge &punctelev; with milce and with o&rrot;e
And þenche þat þou mo&slong;t milsful beo &punctelev; And þat þou bouȝte&slong;t man ful so&rrot;e
Moder seide o&rrot;e louerd þo &punctelev; hov miȝte ich don þi lo&rrot;e
Ne sixtþou hou men me misdoth &punctelev; þat Ine mai hit þolie mo&rrot;e
Leoue sone o&rrot;e lauedi seide &punctelev; abijd ȝeot one &slong;tounde
Ich habbe ane guode Caumpiun &punctelev; to þine bihofþe ifounde
þat schal muche del of þat folk &punctelev; onder þine wille do
And anne felawe ichulle him bitake &punctelev; þat schal helpe him þerto
Lat me iseo o&rrot;e louerd seide &punctelev; ichulle loki ȝweþer hu&ydot; beon ouȝtes
Ore leuedi nam þo seint domenic Domenic &punctelev; and bifo&rrot;e [o&rrot;e] louerd him b&rrot;ouȝte
And seint Fraunceis also guod &punctelev; mi sone heo seide lo
Mi chaumpiun and his felawe &punctelev; þat schullen þis dede do
Ȝe seide o&rrot;e louerd þeos beoth boþe &punctelev; &slong;trongue and guode þerto
Ichulle heom helpe in heo&rrot;e dedes &punctelev; and ȝiue heom grace also
¶Seint Domenic amo&rrot;ewe aros &punctelev; ant to churche wende sone
And on is sweuene þouȝte muche &punctelev; ȝwat him was to done
he &slong;tod and biheold aboute &punctelev; his felawe he gan to[V. of] seo
þat o&rrot;e lauedi him b&rrot;ouȝte aniȝt &punctelev; is felawe fo&rrot;to beo
he ne hadde neuer er him iseiȝe &punctelev; he descreuede him fa&slong;te anon
his face and is bodi also &punctelev; and[om. in V.] him þouȝte it was sw&ydot;ch on
he tok and cu&slong;te him anon &punctelev; ase it was wel riȝt
And tolde him al[V. of al] þat cas &punctelev; hov him matte aniȝt
And E&ydot;þer bigan to schewi oþur &punctelev; heo&rrot;e wille and heo&rrot;e þouȝt
So þat hu&ydot; weren ase god God wolde &punctelev; in o consent ib&rrot;ouȝt
And eiþur dude bi oþeres rede &punctelev; and þeos tweie o&rrot;d&rrot;es wrouȝte
Of frere p&rrot;echours and of frere Meno&rrot;es &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e leuedi heom on b&rrot;ouȝte
¶Seint Domenic þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e of frere p&rrot;echours &punctelev; ase ich habbe iseid
And seint Fraunceis of frere Meno&rrot;es &punctelev; eiþer bi oþeres red
And sire S&ydot;mon de Mountfo&rrot;t &punctelev; þat guod kniȝt was and hende
So&slong;teinede þis holie Men &punctelev; to b&rrot;ingue þis dede to ende
Ich wene ich ma&ydot; fo&rrot; soþe it segge &punctelev; ȝif hu&ydot; nadden ibeo bifounde
þe wo&rrot;ld hadde fo&rrot; grete sune ibeo &punctelev; are þis ib&rrot;ouȝt to grounde
Ȝeot fo&rrot; al þat heo mouwen aboute go &punctelev; to p&rrot;echi and to schriue
Sunne is ȝeot into al þis lond &punctelev; and wrechhede alto riue
here mouwen þis luþere men iseo &punctelev; þat euere spekez to quede
In ȝwuche manere þis guode men &punctelev; bigunne fur&slong;t þis dede
Manie of þis deoueles limes &punctelev; bitwene heom seggez al da&ydot;ȝ
Wel murie was þe wo&rrot;ld and guod &punctelev; are man ani frere isa&ydot;ȝ
Also hu&ydot; spekez heom bifallez &punctelev; fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerd seide iwis
bi þe fru&ydot;t man ma&ydot; iseo &punctelev; ȝwatmanere treo it is
Fo&rrot; þare ne ma&ydot; of no lu&ydot;þur treo &punctelev; no guod fru&ydot;t sp&rrot;ingue
vnneþe ma&ydot; a lu&ydot;þur man ani guod wo&rrot;d &punctelev; out of himsulue b&rrot;ingue
hu&ydot; mouwen loki ȝwanne o&rrot;e louerd &punctelev; heom sm&ydot;t harde inouȝ
with one of his launces þreo &punctelev; þat he to heom d&rrot;ouȝ
þat was fo&rrot; þis tweie holie men &punctelev; þulke t&ydot;me ondo
Fondi heo mouwen heo&rrot;e w&ydot;þerwine [ȝwan][om.] hu&ydot; comiez þarto
Ake hit ne wo&rrot;th neuere fals &punctelev; þat o&rrot;e louerd himself sede
þat his desciples scholden iblessede beo &punctelev; ȝwanne men hem spekez to quede
And seggez heom sco&rrot;n and b&ydot;semare &punctelev; fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerdes name
bi þe freres þus it is &punctelev; of Men þat seggez heom schame
Ake o&rrot;e louerd himsulf wole wreche nime &punctelev; þei it were þo withd&rrot;awe
Fo&rrot; seint Domenic þe holie Man &punctelev; and seint Fraunceis is felawe
þis holie Man seint dominc Dominc &punctelev; Into his o&rrot;d&rrot;e he nam
Ane ȝoungue clerk at one t&ydot;me &punctelev; þat frere p&rrot;echour bicam
And sethþe þo&rrot;uȝ þe feondes lo&rrot;e &punctelev; withd&rrot;ouȝ him atþenende
And seide þat he wolde aȝein &punctelev; to þe wo&rrot;lde wende
he dude of is Abite &punctelev; and is schurte on him ca&slong;te
Seint Dominic sat adoun akneo &punctelev; and fo&rrot; him bad wel fa&slong;te
Ase he seide is o&rrot;esones &punctelev; þe clerk bigan to weopen so&rrot;e
And pitou[s]liche bigan to crie &punctelev; a nouþe merci louerd þin o&rrot;e
þis schurte[MS. schrurte] þat is aboute me &punctelev; fo&rrot;b&rrot;ennez me to grounde
Drawez hire of fo&rrot; godes Godes loue &punctelev; oþur ich deie in lu&ydot;te &slong;tounde
So þat þo&rrot;uȝ o&rrot;e louerdes grace &punctelev; him þouȝte he was fo&rrot;b&rrot;ent
Are he nome aȝein is Abite &punctelev; and hadde is heo&rrot;te iwend
BI a frere also at bolo&ydot;ne &punctelev; bifeol sw&ydot;ch a cas
þat of þe feond ifondet was &punctelev; and withinne him also he was
Seint Domenic it ofþouȝte so&rrot;e &punctelev; and het a godes Godes name
þene feond to helle wende anon &punctelev; and seide ȝwi do&slong;tþou me schuch schame
þov ne þart me blamie nouȝt &punctelev; fo&rrot; with riȝte ich am here[Diabolus.]
þe feond Answerede seint Domenic &punctelev; ase he was in þe frere
Fo&rrot; þes frere cam ȝur&slong;terda&ydot; to toune &punctelev; and d&rrot;onk withoute leue
Ase a lu&ydot;te mot þareInne ich la&ydot; &punctelev; and bigan withinne him weue
Fo&rrot; he ne blessede nouȝt is d&rrot;inke &punctelev; and withoute leue it nam
Wit lawe ich mai in him beo &punctelev; and with lawe in him ich am
Certes seide þis frere he seith soth &punctelev; and riȝt so it is
Ichot i d&rrot;onk ȝur&slong;tai in toune &punctelev; withoute leue iwis
And Ine blessede nouȝt mi d&rrot;inke &punctelev; and a swuch mot þare was Inne
And with þat d&rrot;inke þat ich d&rrot;onk &punctelev; it schet me sone withInne
Euereft he hath Igreued me &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd fram me him b&rrot;ingue
Ase hu&ydot; tolden hereaboute &punctelev; to Mat&ydot;nes hu&ydot; gonne ringue
¶Out out quath þe deuel þo &punctelev; awei ich mot gon
þis þeues with þis wide hodes &punctelev; arise wollez anon
And Ine dar nouȝt abide heo&rrot;e song &punctelev; ad&rrot;ad ich am wel so&rrot;e
he fleu out of þis selie man &punctelev; and ne cam neiȝ him nonmo&rrot;e
As þe holie man seint Domenic &punctelev; and his felawes come
withoute Tolouse bi a watur &punctelev; ase hu&ydot; hadden er ilome
heo&rrot;e bokes fullen into þe watur &punctelev; and sonken anon to grounde
hu&ydot; wenden fo&rrot;th in heo&rrot;e wei &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; ne miȝten beon ifounde
þare cam þane þridde da&ydot; &punctelev; a fischare with is ginne
And ca&slong;te is nettes in þat watur &punctelev; þo felde he heui withInne
þouȝte he here is fisch inouȝ &punctelev; and bigan to d&rrot;awe fa&slong;te
þe holie manness bokes it weren &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; comen fo&rrot;th atþe la&slong;te
Also sounde hu&ydot; weren and d&rrot;u&ydot;e &punctelev; ase hu&ydot; euerer were
Fo&rrot; al þat hu&ydot; leien in þat watur &punctelev; noþing þe wo&rrot;se hu&ydot; nere
¶At one t&ydot;me seint Domenic &punctelev; at rome was isete
And fourti of is freres also &punctelev; with him to þe mete
hu&ydot; nadden bote a lu&ydot;te b&rrot;ed &punctelev; wel lu&ydot;te was þe le&slong;tes
And alle hu&ydot; maden heom also Ioifole &punctelev; ase hu&ydot; weren at one fe&slong;te
Ake natheles hu&ydot; weren ofhungrede so&rrot;e &punctelev; þei hu&ydot; so glade were
þo comen þare tweie child&rrot;en In &punctelev; with wel milde chere
Abite of freres hu&ydot; hadden upon &punctelev; fairo&rrot;e neuere nere
In heo&rrot;e lappene hu&ydot; b&rrot;ouȝten mete &punctelev; ant to seint Domenic hit bere
þo hu&ydot; hadden him þis mete itake &punctelev; hu&ydot; nu&slong;ten ȝware hu&ydot; bicome
þis freres maden heom glade Inouȝ &punctelev; and wo&rrot;deliche fo&rrot;th it nome
¶A dai as þis holie Man &punctelev; in þe Contreie we[n]de
þat lodloke&slong;te weder þat miȝte beo &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd ouer him sende
he bigan to maken is o&rrot;esun &punctelev; his felawe was in doute
þat weder bigan to reinie fa&slong;te &punctelev; in eche side aboute
Ake sone it ȝaf him roume[V. Ac hit bigon to ȝiue him] wei &punctelev; and alaboute withd&rrot;awe
þat bi fif fet it ne cam nouȝt him neiȝ &punctelev; ne also neiȝ his felawe
BIside þe Cite of Toluse bi a watur hu&ydot; come
A man ladde heom ouer In a schip &punctelev; ase he dude oþere ilome
Seint Domenic wolde wende is wei &punctelev; þo he to londe cam
þe passour him het abide &punctelev; and bi þe cope him nam
And seide he scholde him pa&ydot;e is hu&ydot;re &punctelev; were him leof þe loth
he nolde him serui so fo&rrot; nouȝt &punctelev; and þarto he swo&rrot; is oth
Lat me seide þis holie Man &punctelev; par charite fo&rrot;th quijt gon
And god God wole ȝelden þi trauail &punctelev; fo&rrot; ine habbe seoluer non
Al fo&rrot; nouȝt seide þes oþur &punctelev; bi þe fei þat i schal to þe
Mi trauail þou schalt me paie &punctelev; oþur þi cope bileue with me
Ȝwane þou nelt quath þe holie man &punctelev; fo&rrot; godes Godes loue nouȝt do
Ich bidde god God ȝif is wille beo &punctelev; þat he helpe me þerto
þo la&ydot; biside þe schipe þere &punctelev; a peni fair Inovȝ
þe passour beuȝ adoun anon &punctelev; and þane peni to him d&rrot;ouȝ
NIm þare seide þis holie man &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e louerd sende þe
Fo&rrot; inabbe misulf nouȝt &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd aquitez me
Ore suete louerd nolde nouȝt &punctelev; þat þe freres ilette were
himsulf he sende heom heo&rrot;e schiphu&ydot;re &punctelev; fair miracle was þere
¶Also þis holie man a niȝt &punctelev; In his o&rrot;esones la&ydot;
bi himsulf in p&rrot;iueite &punctelev; ase he dude niȝt and da&ydot;
þe deuel cam and &slong;tod bi him &punctelev; In Abite of frere
Womme seide þe holie man &punctelev; ȝwat do&slong;t þov nouþe here
Ȝw&ydot; nartþov In þine bedde aslepe &punctelev; In þe do&rrot;tour with þine fere
þov wo&slong;t wel it nis nouȝt o&rrot;d&rrot;e &punctelev; ne non riȝt guod manere
þe Deuel &slong;tod and made him signe &punctelev; ase hoso seith inelle nouȝt speke
Ne so muche misdon aȝeines god God &punctelev; is o&rrot;d&rrot;e fo&rrot;to b&rrot;eke[V. has 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
¶Seint Domenic hadde wonder þarof &punctelev; ȝwat frere it miȝte beo
þat so wel is o&rrot;d&rrot;e heold &punctelev; he þouȝte he wolde iseo
he wende and liȝte ane candle &punctelev; and biheold þis frere
þo he wu&slong;te ȝwat he was &punctelev; he þouȝte ȝwat do&slong;t þou here
he blamede him[MS. hẹiọm] su&ydot;þe muche &punctelev; ȝwat he dude þo þere
Fo&rrot; it were betere is riȝte &punctelev; þat he in helle were
[diabolus.]¶þou misde&slong;t mo&rrot;e þe deuel seide &punctelev; þin o&rrot;d&rrot;e fo&rrot;to b&rrot;eke
Fo&rrot; þou wo&slong;t wel þis t&ydot;me &punctelev; it ne fallez þe nouȝt to speke
[Dominicus.]¶þou ne sei&slong;t nouȝt riȝt quath seint Domenic &punctelev; "fo&rrot; þe p&rrot;io&rrot; ma&ydot;
Fo&rrot;to wissi is ȝoungue freres &punctelev; speken niȝt and da&ydot;
Ich hote þat þou me telle &punctelev; nouþe þou art allingues here
Ȝwarewith þou fonde&slong;t me&slong;t &punctelev; In churche ani frere
¶bote ich makie seide þe deuel þo &punctelev; late to churche gon[diabolus.]
And ȝwane he alles þareinne is &punctelev; out þannes to wiende anon
[Dominicus.]Of þe do&rrot;to&rrot;e he axede him &punctelev; ȝwat were þare is dede
[diabolus.]¶bote ich makie freres to ligge longue &punctelev; in heo&rrot;e bedde he sede
And þe [ȝwile][om.] hu&ydot; þarinne beoth &punctelev; hu&ydot; þenchez[V. þenken on] vuel þouȝt
hit is on of Mine be&slong;te hous &punctelev; Inelle bileue it nouȝt
[Dominicus.]¶Seint Domenic axede of þe freito&rrot;e &punctelev; ȝwat is þi dede þere
[diabolus.]bote ich fondi þe dedes þere &punctelev; of glotonie fo&rrot;to arere
Ich makie freres to muchel ete &punctelev; and to d&rrot;inke also
Fo&rrot;to maken heom feble &punctelev; godes Godes seruise to do
[Dominicus.]¶Ȝwat In þe parlo&rrot;e seint Domenic seide &punctelev; beo nouþe soth aknouwe
[diabolus.]A beo &slong;tille seide þe schrewe þo &punctelev; þat hous is al min owe
Fo&rrot; ich heom makie telle þere &punctelev; euerech oþur t&ydot;þingue
And make heom þenche and speke also &punctelev; of folies and lesinge
[Dominicus.]¶And ȝwat þe chapitle seint Domenic seide &punctelev; miȝt þou þare ouȝt winne
[diabolus.]A beo &slong;tille þe schrewe seide &punctelev; neuere Ine cam þareInne
Longue fo&rrot; þou it ha&slong;t inemd &punctelev; þe wo&rrot;se me schal beo
God ne suffri me neuere þareinne come &punctelev; ne enes it iseo
Al þat ich habbe iwonne ada&ydot; &punctelev; and þe niȝt bifo&rrot;e
Sone so þine freres þudere comieth &punctelev; al ich habbe ilo&rrot;e
Iw&ydot;ped it is al[V. as] clene awe&ydot; &punctelev; ase it neuere nere
Aco&rrot;sed is al þulke &slong;tude &punctelev; ne come ich neuere þere
þo wende þe schrewe is wei &punctelev; and lu&ydot;te hadde iwonne
And þe holie man is beden seide &punctelev; ase he hadde bigonne
LOngue leouede þis holie man &punctelev; in guode liue inouȝ
And is o&rrot;d&rrot;e in guod po&ydot;nt b&rrot;ouȝte &punctelev; are he to deþe d&rrot;ouȝ
At þe la&slong;te ase god God it wolde &punctelev; þat he scholde heonnes wende
A[V. Atte] frere p&rrot;echur[s] of bolo&ydot;gne &punctelev; [he] d&rrot;ov toward is ende
he hadde a couent of [twelue] freres &punctelev; þo he d&rrot;ou toward þe deþe
his[V. þis] twelf freres bifo&rrot;e him comen &punctelev; himseolf was þe þretteþe &punctelev; [The halflines transp. in V.]
he p&rrot;echede heom faire inouȝ &punctelev; to siwi godes Godes lo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot;to holden þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e wel &punctelev; and to echen as mo&rrot;e and mo&rrot;e
Of þreo þing he made is te&slong;tament[V. quide] &punctelev; riȝt bifo&rrot;e his deþe
pouerte. and loue. and Meoknesse &punctelev; his b&rrot;eþren he dude[om. in V.] biqueþe
þat hu&ydot; weren euere in guode loue &punctelev; and in Meoknesse also
And þat hu&ydot; ladden heo&rrot;e lijf in pouerte &punctelev; and euere heolden þerto
Fo&rrot; he foundede ho&rrot;e o&rrot;d&rrot;e fur&slong;t &punctelev; ope þeos þingues þreo
And biquath sethþen alle þo &punctelev; þat wolden is b&rrot;eþren beo
he ȝaf alle godes Godes curs and his &punctelev; þat his o&rrot;d&rrot;e fu&ydot;lden ouȝt
with grete richesse and wo&rrot;ldes feo &punctelev; fo&rrot; þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e it nolde nouȝt
þo he hadde imaked is te&slong;tament &punctelev; he deide riȝt in þe place
And biteiȝte þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e and is soule &punctelev; al In o&rrot;e louerdes grace
he deide twelf hund&rrot;ed ȝer &punctelev; and foursco&rrot;e[V. twenti] ȝer and on[o&rrot;ig. two]
Aftur þat o&rrot;e louerd nam &punctelev; of is moder flechs and bon
And endleue hound&rrot;et ȝer &punctelev; and foursco&rrot;e ȝer and tene
Aftur þat o&rrot;e louerd on eo&rrot;þe cam &punctelev; he bigan þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e ich wene
Wel auȝte we blessi þe t&ydot;me &punctelev; þat euere he was bigunne
Fo&rrot; mani a soule ichot he hath &punctelev; to godes Godes bihofþe iwonne
¶þo þis holie Man seint Dominic &punctelev; bigan of þis liue gon
Into þe Io&ydot;e of heuene &punctelev; his soule wende anon
Fo&rrot; ase þe p&rrot;io&rrot; of bixe[V. Bride] &punctelev; þo in is bedde aslepe la&ydot;
h&ydot;m þouȝte riȝt þulke t&ydot;me &punctelev; þat he a gret ladd&rrot;e isa&ydot;
þe ladd&rrot;e schon sw&ydot;þe b&rrot;iȝte &punctelev; into heuene an heiȝ
Ore louerd onouewarde &punctelev; and o&rrot;e leuedi he iseiȝ
Al bineoþe sat a frere &punctelev; in is scapelo&rrot;i ȝwijt
his hod id&rrot;awe ouer is eiȝen &punctelev; riȝt in his Abijt
Ase he sat on þis ladd&rrot;e lowe &punctelev; on þe neþeme&slong;te roungue
Aungles þare eoden up and doun &punctelev; And swiþe murie hu&ydot; songue
Ore louerd heold þis ladd&rrot;e an heiȝ &punctelev; and o&rrot;e leuedi also
And d&rrot;owen þane frere up þarebi &punctelev; þat þaron was ido
In his Abijte hu&ydot; d&rrot;owen him up &punctelev; into heouene an heiȝ
And al þat clere lijȝt of heouene &punctelev; him þouȝte þat he iseiȝ
And heouene smot togadere anon &punctelev; þo he was withInne ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þo þis p&rrot;io&rrot; awok &punctelev; he la&ydot; in grete þouȝt
his b&rrot;eþren he let cleopie anon &punctelev; and seide ichot iwis
Þat þis holie man seint Domenic &punctelev; out of þis liue he is
Fo&rrot; i saiȝ him riȝt nouþe he seide &punctelev; to þe Io&ydot;e of heuene go
Þe soþe hu&ydot; ofAxeden sethþe &punctelev; þat he deide riȝt þo
bidde we ȝeo&rrot;ne seint Dominic &punctelev; þat þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e hath iwrouȝt
Þat we beon fo&rrot;th with him &punctelev; to þe Io&ydot;e of heuene ib&rrot;ouȝt
bidde we o&rrot;e louerd and o&rrot;e lauedi &punctelev; fo&rrot; seint Dominikes loue
Þat we moten aftur o&rrot;e endeda&ydot; &punctelev; to þe blisse of heuene come
